definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: She packed the glass in straw so that it wouldn't break.
sentences.chinese: 她把玻璃用草包住，這樣就不會打碎了。

sentences.english: Wow, your new boyfriend is screwed.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你的現任男友真草包。

sentences.english: The employee he hired last month was found to be an apple of Sodom.
sentences.chinese: 他發現上個月聘用的新人實在是草包一個。

sentences.english: That man is a bungling oaf.
The company will be one schock manager short .
sentences.chinese: 這家公司少了一個草包經理，豈不更好。

sentences.english: Hyssop contains a fatty acid that stimulates the skin to reproduce.
sentences.chinese: 海索草包含有一種脂肪酸，激勵皮膚再生長。

sentences.english: Had I been a mere clod, you would not have desired me for a husband.
sentences.chinese: 如果我僅僅是個草包，你也就不會渴望嫁給我了。

sentences.english: Ken is a sweet piece of man candy.
sentences.chinese: 肯就是個甜美的草包美男。

definition: wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
rice tub (from which cooked rice or other food is served)/(fig.) fathead/a good-for-nothing
unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2
